Posts.Content: Thanks Helen I have doctor on 5th so will ask.  The pain has made me cut my working hours but it's getting worse and causing problems with my job as high pressure and may cause my job to come to an end.
Posts.Title: RE: chronic back and hip pain after cancer treatments.

Posts.Content: Anyone in this group having increasing problem pain in hips, feet, legs and back after treatment has ended,  on Tamoxifen.  Doctor not helping
Posts.Title: RE: chronic back and hip pain after cancer treatments.

Posts.Content: Jane I used plain Simple shampoo while I had no hair and as it came through for several months after.  No question on this site is trivial hugs
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Hi new2this glad you are finding help here.  I managed to keep my finger nails with a lot of work  my toes however not so good.  It is two years since my treatment ended and I am still having problems sleeping  my legs and feet are getting more and more sore and so tired I have just accepted severance after 35 years. It's different for everyone and hard going at times but need to keep strong xx
Posts.Title: does anybody talk here?

Posts.Content: HI Eden You have done a good thing coming on here. You will always get the support you need and you will find yourself giving help and support to others. BC diagnosed 2012 finished chemo and radiotherapy 2014. Been a big change to my life. Live for the day. Big hug x
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Hi butterfly 2212 yes it could be fatigue but get your bloods checked. The chemotherapy did for my thyroid and my B 12 all but disappeared. I am coming up on my second year and am in a lot of pain hips, legs and feet. Just keep talking to your doctor. If you are on Tamoxifen that can also give you these side effects.
Posts.Title: body aches

Posts.Content: You have a great support there. Most people expect you to be all happy happy just because you have finished treatment,  it's not that simple and he seems to understand x
Posts.Title: body aches

Posts.Content: Keep an eye on your nails, hands and feet. Put oil, hand cream etc on them as Docetaxel can damage to the point they fall off. All the same as the others nose bleeds that lasted over two hours had to go to A&E. I have a problem with my spine and this does cause pain in the bones and joints anything you already have a weakness in. This is a hard one but it will pass, after my first Docetaxel I was in so much pain I wanted to call the hospital and say I didn't want the rest. You will get through it, do what ever helps. X
Posts.Title: Docetaxel & Heceptin Chemo
